meanings.definition: To flow out rapidly and in large quantities
meanings.sent1: Water can gush from a broken pipe.
meanings.sent2: The waterfall gushed down the rocks.
meanings.sent3: The juice decided to gush out of the bottle at the worst time.
meanings.sent4: Emotions can gush out unexpectedly, like a burst dam.
meanings.sent5: The burst balloon made the water gush out with force.

meanings.definition: To express oneself effusively or with enthusiasm
meanings.sent1: She would gush about her favorite book to anyone who would listen.
meanings.sent2: The fans would gush over the movie star's performance.
meanings.sent3: The puppy would gush with excitement every time its owner returned home.
meanings.sent4: Her words gushed out like a waterfall of praise.
meanings.sent5: His gratitude would gush out in heartfelt words.

meanings.definition: A sudden and abundant flow of liquid
meanings.sent1: The gush of water from the burst pipe flooded the basement.
meanings.sent2: The sudden gush of rain caught everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent3: The gush of soda from the shaken can made a sticky mess.
meanings.sent4: The gush of tears was a release of pent-up emotions.
meanings.sent5: The gush of lava from the volcano was a sight to behold.
